sentences.sContent: Then, when much blood had clogged their chariot-wheels, I would go up and wash them from sweet wells, Even with truths that lie too deep for taint.
sentences.sContent_eng: Then, when much blood had clogged their chariot-wheels, I would go up and wash them from sweet wells, Even with truths that lie too deep for taint.
sentences.sCn: 因此当大量的血液凝固，阻塞了战车前进的轮之际，我就要起身，用甘甜清澈的井水刷洗猩红，甚至是用深深隐藏在污点后的事实。

sentences.sContent: When humans first started building things, determining whether they would work as planned was mostly a matter of trial and error. Build a bridge, drive a chariot across it, and see if it collapsed.
sentences.sContent_eng: When humans first started building things, determining whether they would work as planned was mostly a matter of trial and error. Build a bridge, drive a chariot across it, and see if it collapsed.
sentences.sCn: 一开始人类建造房屋时,决定房屋是否合格的方法是去试一下,看看有什么不妥的地方.建成一座桥,把辆战车开上面跑一跑,看看桥会不会倒.

sentences.sContent: I drove my chariot to the vineyard gate, and there I saw the twoKings.
sentences.sContent_eng: I drove my chariot to the vineyard gate, and there I saw the twoKings.
sentences.sCn: 我驾着战车来到葡萄园的门口，看到了那两个国王。

trans.tranOther: a vehicle with two wheels pulled by a horse, used in ancient times in battles and races

trans.tranCn: 驾驭（过去式charioted，过去分词charioted，现在分词charioting，第三人称单数chariots）
